The Government were unable to provide the list for DATE of DATE , as these lists are not kept , but asserted that it would , in accordance with the usual practice , have indicated ORG as the place of the hearing in the applicant 's case . CARDINAL . Thereupon , the applicant filed an appeal on points of law and fact , as well as against sentence ( GPE wegen GPE , PERSON ) . CARDINAL . ORG dismissed the case . CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW ( Bundesverfassungsgesetz ) provides :
“ Hearings by trial courts in ... criminal cases shall be oral and public . Exceptions may be prescribed by law . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW ( Strafprozessordnung ) provides that the trial is to be public . Failure to comply with this requirement constitutes a ground of nullity .

According to LAW , the public may be excluded from the trial in the interests of morals or public order . The court has to take a formal decision on the exclusion of the public . No remedy lies against such a decision .
Pursuant to Article CARDINAL , the above provisions apply to proceedings before a single judge .
CARDINAL . According to LAW taken together with LAW , an appeal hearing against a judgment of a single judge has to be public . Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL apply .

CARDINAL . According to LAW taken together with LAW , an appeal on points of law and fact and against sentence lies against the judgment of a single judge . By virtue of LAW , the appellant may adduce new facts and evidence .

In accordance with LAW , the appellate court will rehear witnesses and experts if it has doubts as to the correctness of the first - instance court 's establishment of the facts , or if it holds that the hearing of new witnesses or experts as regards the same facts is necessary . Otherwise , it will take its decision on the basis of the file .
